turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Flip.  You're the closest thing I got to a friend around here.  Tell me something.  You think I'm crazy?

turns.speaker: FLIP
turns.text: Shut the hell up.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I don't see the connection.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Come on!  Six major earthquakes in the last three years?  The space shuttle in orbit for every one of them?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Testing some top secret seismic weapon.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Not testing.  <u>Using</u>.  Nukes are passe.  This is the weapon of the future.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I still don't see what it has to do with the President.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Do you still ride?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Not for years.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So why do you keep the picture up? You wish you hadn't quit?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Well, I -- Jerry, the point.  Get there.  What does it have to do with the President?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The President's in Europe. Tomorrow he'll be in Turkey. Right along this fault line.  They launched the space shuttle yesterday.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Motive?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He's cutting funding for NASA. The milk cow of the aerospace industry.  We're talking billions. Motive enough?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: <u>NASA</u> is going to kill the President of the United States with an earthquake.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Not exactly the kind of thing a Secret Service Agent can throw himself on top of.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You going to warn him?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I can't promise you anything.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You think I'm crazy.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I think you're different.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know, to be 'normal' and live in the 'real world,' to swallow Coca cola and eat Kentucky Fried Chicken, you have to be in a conspiracy <u>against yourself</u>.  I can't lie to me, Liza.  And the more I strip through the sham, the crazier I look to people like you. Can't you see that's what they're counting on?  You want to go out sometime?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I better get going.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You don't have to burst in here every time, Jerry.  Just call and make an appointment.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What was your horse's name?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Johnny Dancer.  You've been in my office ten times.  How come you never asked me about that picture before?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Was waiting till I knew you better.  Johnny Dancer, huh? Sounds like a racehorse.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I bit the bastard's nose off.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You bit someone's nose off?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yes!  Don't let's get into this thing where I have to repeat myself!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's a man without a nose you want, you dumb complicit sons of bitches!  You've got to listen to me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Put down the gun and I'll take your statement.  Okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're the boss.  Just don't make me repeat myself.  I hate that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What's the charge?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You were there, Jerry.  Figure it out.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Just relax.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Switch the charts.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Switch 'em.  Or I'll be dead by morning.  Don't want to be dead.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey...  I can't control it.  It's just, something that happened.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What is?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Love.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: People do have heart attacks.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sure.  You switched the charts, didn't you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's okay.  The guy traded bullets with some old man in a liquor store.  He had it coming.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You expect me to believe what, that someone came in here last night.  Gave that guy... something that stopped his heart?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You switched the charts; you tell me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I got to get downstairs.  The C.I.A., they want to see your body.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I won't be here when you get back, but I'll be in touch.  And thanks.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You saved my life.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: <u>Heart attacks happen</u>.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: He says a dog bit his nose.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Arf... You gotta help me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I can't promise you anything.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Lucky guess... Um, I'd feel a lot less naked if we could get outta here.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Don't tell me you're naked back there.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Figure of speech.  Could we go?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What took so long?  You were in there all day.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: That's how long it takes to turn a hospital inside out.  A lot of people are after you, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Dead or alive, they'll stick me in there with Oswald.  Another lunatic acting alone,

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Oswald was an assassin.  You're not an assassin, are you, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: If you're worried about the President, call and warn him about the Space Shuttle.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Right.  Sit up so I can see you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Uh uh, don't want <u>them</u> to see me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Them who?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Change lanes.  Then watch your rearview.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Flat, wraparound headlights?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Crown Victoria.  F.B.I. car.  A legitimate tail.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: As opposed to?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: People more serious about their work. You know how to drive this thing or do you just like looking good in it?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You mean I should speed up and try and lose them?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: That's how a man would do it.  I'm not a man.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I noticed.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: See?  Wasn't that a lot easier than squealing tires and knocking over trash cans?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Nothing is easy.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: How long have we known each other, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Six months.  Eleven days.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Till today, I haven't believed a word.  Now, I'm curious.  Six months, eleven days.  I'm going to give you one more hour to impress me.  Where to?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You have the right to ask me certain personal questions?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah.  I think so.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Nothing scary there.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, well, maybe to the untrained eye.  Hmm... Ahh...  Ooooo...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: More about life on Mars.  From a rock they <u>found</u> on the South Pole. Explain that one to me.  But maybe we should go to Mars and find out? How much do you think that's going to cost?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What is it with you and the space program?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And look here.  Cease fire in Chechenia.  That's good for the banks who lent the government money, but bad for the guys selling them weapons.  Listen to this, some gas company in Colorado.  Their researchers have been blocked from testing a fuel additive.  They've accused the E.P.A. of, quote, 'turning a blind <u>eye</u> to the future.'

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well that's the eye right there. <u>Money</u>.  And all the power and misery it brings with it. It's a plot to take over the world.  The Master Conspiracy. Can take a lifetime to pull off.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Do they have a secret handshake?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I have no idea.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: So why are they after you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not sure.  I think I figured something out.  It must've been in my newsletter.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What newsletter?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So I'm a little jumpy.  Who wouldn't be?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You're certifiable.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You wouldn't be sitting here if you didn't halfway believe me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Believe you about what?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Flesh wound.  No big deal.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know why the Grateful Dead are always on tour?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Surprise me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The whole kit and caboodle of 'em are British Intelligence agents. <u>Spies</u>.  Jerry Garcia had a double- o rating.  Just like James Bond.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You want something to drink?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Um, coffee.  If that's okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: If my universe had a hub...

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: This would be it?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Equitation.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I've been reading up on it.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Are these yours?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Here it is.  <u>Conspiracy Theory</u>  It just went out Tuesday.  Third issue this year.  I bet I struck a nerve.  Pissed someone off.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: 'The Space Shuttle's Seismic Secret'.  'The Oliver Stone-George Bush Connection'.  Oliver Stone?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Stone is their spokesman.  You think if someone really had all that information and a national podium to shout it out from that they'd let him do it?  Stone's a disinformation flunky.  The face that he's alive says it all.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Can you prove any of this?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Absolutely not.  A good conspiracy is an unprovable conspiracy.  If you can figure it out, they screwed it up.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: 'On July 8, 1979, security forces under control of the Trilateral Commission abducted the fathers of all American Nobel Prize winners. The men, many of them octogenarians, were forced at gunpoint to ejaculate into small plastic bottles.  The sperm collected is now under study in a laboratory beneath the headquarters of the Rand Corporation in Santa Monica, California.'

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Pretty scary, huh?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Yeah... how many subscribers do you have?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Just five.  It's the economy... You think maybe one of them is not who they seem?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You got a list?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You're a Holden Caulfield fan.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Holden Caulfield?  <u>Catcher in the</u> <u>Rye</u>?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You have ten copies of the book, but you don't know who the main character is?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I've never read it.  I just -- Every time I see one I buy it.  I don't know why exactly... Wanna hear my favorite part?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Getting rid of my hub!

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Was that who I thought it was?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Has this happened to you before?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Never, but I've been practicing.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Who are you, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Just a guy trying to put out a fire.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You gave me an hour; now give me a day.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Jerry, there's something I have to ask you.  Actually about a hundred things, but we can make progress, if you answer one question.  To my satisfaction.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: It was that painting.  The one on the wall.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I didn't mean for you to see it. It's like looking in someone's diary and taking it out of context.  Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: It made me feel like you could see inside of me.  And I don't know how that's possible.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So what's the question?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: How is it possible?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I'll give you 100 bucks if you leave right now.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Is this your dad?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: That was him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Is he dead?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Please put it down.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How'd he die?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: He was murdered.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He's why you punish yourself.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Not this again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You run with your back to the picture.  Like you were trying to get away.  Once in awhile you sing along with music, but mostly you punish yourself.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You watch me, don't you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Johnny Dancer, right?  You don't ride him anymore, do you?  Not since your dad died.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Fuck you.  I know you're crazy, but fuck you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Did you see the van back there?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What van?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Never mind.  You'd think I was making it up.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Where'd you get your subscribers?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I put an ad on a computer bulletin board.  I log on at the library so I can't be traced.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Well, I've been tracking them down all morning.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You haven't been bothering them, have you?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: They're dead.  Four out of five anyhow.  All in the last 24 hours. One car accident, two heart attacks and a stroke.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Jesus... It's my fault.  They drew a black line over me and now I'm passing it on.  I'm passing it to you, too.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I'll be fine.  Let's worry about Henry Finch.  P.O. Box in St. Louis.  He's the last on the list. I haven't been able to reach him yet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Maybe you better not try... I worked so hard to keep quiet. Like a mouse.  I should have realized.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Realized what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Henry Finch.  That they monitor everything.  That it was only a matter of time.  And now four people are dead.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Elaborate on 'they,' okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: There are all kinds of groups, all kinds of initials.  But they're all part of two warring factions. One:  families that have held wealth for centuries. They want one thing.  Stability. Group Two:  the boat rockers. Eisenhower's military industrial complex.  They want instability. It's a trillion dollar a year business.  When there isn't a hot war, they make a cold one.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Cold War's over, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So now they feed us terrorists. <u>To create fear</u>.  How much do you think an airport security system goes for?  Then multiply it by every airport in the country.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: And you think Group One is at war with Group Two.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Latest casualty?  Ernest Harriman. You heard of him?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Sure. One of the richest men in America until he died a few days ago.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: His obituary was in every paper. But not one of them said he was murdered.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Murdered?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Right here in Manhattan.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: It said in the paper he drowned in a swimming pool.  <u>In Newport</u>.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Nobody dies in Newport.  They couldn't even kill Sunny von Bulow there.  Harriman drowned, but it wasn't in Newport.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Where then?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Right here.  In the 7th Street subway station.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What was he doing down here?  A billionaire waiting for the subway?  Why not drown him in a bus?  Why drown him at all?  Why not shoot him?  Is the hitman from the lost world of Atlantis?  I mean, come on.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I see the big picture and you stumble around in the details.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: They're big details, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Do you watch the news?  Read the paper.  Last week, this whole place was underwater.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: A water main broke.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They don't break in the summer! Do you know what building is right over this spot?  Harriman Tower. Their sub-basement was flooded! He didn't die in a pool.  Call the coroner in Rhode Island!  Ask if the water in his lungs was chlorinated!

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Okay, I will.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You will?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: If that's what you want.  Yes.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't know what to say.  I love you.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I -- It's like, I resolve to call you up 1000 times a day.  To ask you if you'll marry me in some old-fashioned way.  Everything you do is magic.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Those are song lyrics, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know that.  I'm just -- I'm nervous.  I reached out and grabbed the first thing out there. I know they're song lyrics.  And I know how I feel.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I like you, Jerry.  A lot.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, Christ, here it comes.  Look, I know you think I'm crazy.  I don't think I am, but...

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Jerry, I --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What if I reached a point where you didn't think I was crazy anymore?  If I was normal.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: If you were eating Kentucky Fried Chicken and drinking Coca-Cola again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah...  Would you, I mean, could you love me then?  If I was normal.  Maybe?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Don't do this to yourself.  Jerry. You don't love me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're wrong.  Since I met you, I don't dream about holes anymore.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Holes?  I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yesterday you were wondering about the wall.  How it was possible.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Now's not really the time to get into this --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's Geronimo.  Love. It lets you see things.  It gives you insight. I've loved you since the first time I saw you.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Answer me.  Was the first time you saw me the first time I saw you? Was it?  You've been following me around.  Do you see how that could be disconcerting to me?  That's not love, Jerry.  It's obsession. And it isn't normal and you can't expect me to respond to it and you can't expect me to feel the same way.  Can you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I would never hurt you, Liza. Think whatever you want, but don't think that.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I don't.  I know you wouldn't.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I thought you -- Why -- Love ruins everything, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You look great.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Are you okay?  I wish I hadn't told you what I did.  But I can't help the way I feel.  You don't hold that against me, do you?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: No.  That wouldn't be fair.  Where are we going, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It would be a lot easier for me to show you instead of tell you.  But first things first.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: There's a car following us. Probably another one flanking us the next street over.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: We're going to Queens?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Not today.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This way.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: After you.  It's okay.  I'm the one who left it here.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Where are we going, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Connecticut.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What's in Connecticut?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What about them?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How come serial killers have two names, but lone gunman assassins have three.  John <u>Wilkes</u> Booth. Mark <u>David</u> Chapman.  Lee <u>Harvey</u> Oswald.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: John Hinkley.  The guy who shot Reagan.  He only had two names.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Reagan didn't die.  If he had died, everybody would know what Johnny's middle name was.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: My father's house.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How do you really know there's gold in Fort Knox?  Just because they say so?  We should go to Tennessee and demand to see it.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You go.  Send me a postcard.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Liza?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Did you kill him?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Is that what they told you?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Did you kill my father?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Then why did you have his picture in your safe deposit box?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He gave it to me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Where were you the day he died?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: At a horse show.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's the last time you rode, isn't it?  Do you think it was your fault?  Is that why?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Did you kill my father?!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No...!  But they trained me to. M.K. ULTRA.  EX-CATCHER.  America works.  Get rid of the crazy people, the lone gunmen, and the system still works.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Jerry.  Please.  You don't understand.  I have to know.  It's all I think about.  Do you have any idea what it's like not to know?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah.  I know what it's like.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Then tell me what happened.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Can't give you the details because I can't remember.  I went to court to kill him.  At the Ezekiel Walters hearing.  I was supposed to shoot him at the press conference.  You were there. That's the first time I saw you.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Love at first sight?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't know what it was.  All I know is I had a gun in my hand, but when I saw you standing with him, I couldn't do it.  If that's love, it's not so bad.  I found a part of myself that day. I couldn't go back.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Back where?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: To Jonas.  I didn't know that at the time.  Didn't know who he was.  But I knew inside, whoever he was, he'd send someone else.  So I started watching your father.  I wanted to keep him safe.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Someone else might call it stalking.  My dad felt it.  He started carrying a gun.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He kept it in the side table in the front hallway.  He showed me.  I visited a few times.  Then one of Jonas's guys visited.  When I arrived, your dad was dying.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Why?  What do these guys have to do with Ezekiel Walters?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Walters was their fall guy.  Blow up a building and blame a nut. Create fear.  Don't you see?  Your father wasn't trying to keep Walters in prison.  He was looking into getting him out.  He didn't believe the official story.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: <u>Why not, Jerry</u>?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Because he believed me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: How'd you get the picture?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Your father, he was dying.  He was worried about you.  He took your picture out to look at it.  He called you his baby.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I believe you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You got to get out of here.  My cell phone's on.  Back in the truck.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They'll trace it.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's okay.  You...  You thought I was bad.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Blue moon... Blue moon...

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Jerry...?  <u>Jerry</u>.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Blue moon...

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You saw me standing alone ...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Without a song in my heart.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Without a love of my own.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Blue moon...

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You knew just what I was there for.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Liza?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I spent two years here.  This used to bring the med-cart.  Demerol. Phenobarb.  It's Jacob's Ladder.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Get in.  I'll pull you up to the fourth floor.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Get up there and we'll get it back down here for me.  <u>Now</u>.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Geronimo is down.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's up.  Love gives you wings. You can fly away from here.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Don't do this.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Don't die on me, Jerry.  Okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I can't promise you anything.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You've been my best friend for years and I didn't even know you were out there.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Top pocket...  Go on.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They changed Franklin's portrait.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You think it's a conspiracy?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Don't know, but he looks a lot more like Rosie O'Donnel than Ben Franklin.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I love you, too.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now she tells me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Yes you do, Jerry.  Quite well.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: I'm a very patient man.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's great.  Good for you.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Who have you been talking to, Jerry?  Who else knows what you know?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Could you be a little more specific?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Lysergic acid diethylamide... With a little kicker of my own.  Surely it must be coming back to you by now?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: We've arranged for you to take the blame.  Everyone knows how you've been harassing the poor girl.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: <u>Liza</u>!

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: You shouldn't watch, Jerry.  It's a moment without hope.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You've never seen her run.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Liza Sutton is dead.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Then I can't be hurt anymore.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: You're welcome.  Where's my partner?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I like that.  A gun to your head and you ask about your partner. He's okay.  May have a headache for a few days.  Are you here with honorable intentions?

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: I'm not sure what you mean.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You should think of me as Liza Sutton's guardian angel.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: That's ironic.  Because we're here to protect her from you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're here because you figured I might show up.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: It seemed like a possibility. What about your intentions?  Are they honorable?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not a violent man, Mr. Lowry. Not by nature, anyhow.  But if you hurt Liza in any way, I'll kill you.  Does that seem honorable?

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: Well, I don't know if --

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: You made your decision yet?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm leaning toward no.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: That's your option.  Ours could be to keep you locked up for a very long time.  In case you didn't know it, you're crazy.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll do it.  On one condition.  I want to make sure she's okay.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: We got someone watching her 24 hours a day.  She --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's not what I mean.  I want to see her.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Then screw you.  I'll rot.

turns.speaker: LOWRY
turns.text: Alright.  You can see her.  But she can't see you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: A dog bit it.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: You were going to ask about my nose.  The poor animal is slated to be destroyed today.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: And you feel bad for it?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: It was my dog.  Let me ask you a question.  How long have you been acquainted with Jerry?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: So he thinks NASA is plotting to kill the President?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You already asked me that.  Why do you insist on making me repeat myself?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: And you have no idea where he lives?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You've asked me that one three times.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Here's a fresh one.  Why you? Your colleague Mr. Wilson says Jerry won't speak to anyone else. That seems oddly possessive behavior to me.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I'm sorry.  What was the question again?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: <u>Why you</u>?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Honestly?  I think he has a crush on me.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: A charming term.  Now, <u>why him</u>?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Jerry's visits to your office. Why do you tolerate them?  Why him?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: A year ago I was leaving work late one night.  Two guys tried to mug me.  It was horrible.  Jerry came out of nowhere.  To my rescue. Then he started coming to see me.  Could've been a storybook if he wasn't crazy.  At first I did my beat to avoid him.  But there's something inside Jerry and...  Jerry made me see it.  <u>He made me</u> <u>see him</u>.  That make sense?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Veritas.  Truth.  What is it they say about truth?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: The truth shall make you free.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: That's it.  I went to Yale.  I hope you won't hold that against me.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Only on the football field.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I didn't know the C.I.A. had psychiatrists.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: We're very specialized.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Brain washing, mind control, that sort of thing?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Re-educating trained killers in the ways of polite society. Making sure the men who've gone over the edge won't hurt anyone. That sort of thing.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: If you're as impressed to see me as I am to see you, you're very impressed indeed.  How's Jerry feeling this morning?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Fine.  What the hell is going on?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Please, sit.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: What I'm about to tell you is partially documented.  The Freedom of Information Act saw to that. But much more of it isn't.  For reasons which will soon be regrettably clear, I'm going to share -- secrets -- with you. Repeat any of it and you'll simply bestow the title of 'paranoid' upon yourself.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Truth'll set you free.  I'm listening.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Years ago, I worked for the C.I.A. in the M.K. ULTRA program.  Are you familiar with it?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: It was mind control.  <u>Manchurian</u> <u>Candidate</u> kind of stuff, right?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: A vulgar pop term, but yes.  Take an ordinary man and turn him into an assassin.  That was our goal.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Ask what you can do for your country.  That kind of thing.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: M.K. ULTRA was terminated in 1973. But not the research. It was renamed.  EX CATCHER.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: As in <u>Catcher in the Rye</u>?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: I am impressed.  We used the distinctive cover as a sort of mental flash card.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: We experimented with hallucinogens.  We used electro- shock to produce a vegetative state.  We conducted terminal experiments in sensory deprivation.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Terminal?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: As in 'resulting in death.'  We pushed the envelope until it wasn't even an envelope anymore.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: If I had any idea what to charge you with or how to prove it, I'd arrest you right here.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Me?  I was a minor missionary, a heretic really.  But where else could a red-blooded American boy lie, cheat, steal and kill with the sanction and blessings of the All-Highs?  Besides, now I'm trying to pay my penance.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Missionary?  Penance?  You talk about it like it was a religion.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: It was.  It was.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Jerry told me he bit your nose.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: And what did I say?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: A dog.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: <u>My dog</u>.  One I intend to put to sleep.  Extrapolate from there.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: These things you're talking about. You did them to Jerry?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Yes, that's right.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I'm still listening.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Jerry is dangerous.  Jerry has killed --

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Belief is immaterial.  What's important is the truth... It's been my job to find Jerry.  I'm very much responsible for him.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: If this was a spy novel, your next words would be something like I now know too much to live.  Why are you telling me all this?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: So you'll believe what I tell you next.  Because I need to find Jerry.  And I don't think I can do that without you.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Where'd you get it?

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: You do recognize it then?

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: It was my father's.  Kept it in his wallet.  He was murdered --

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: I know the story.  A federal judge.  He denied a man in prison an appeal for a new trial.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: Not a man.  Ezekiel Walters.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: Walters had nothing to do with your father's murder.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: You sound so sure.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: In Jerry's safety deposit box.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: LIZA
turns.text: It's okay.  I'm game.

turns.speaker: JONAS
turns.text: I want this box rigged with a beacon!
